text:
According to the HTTP 1.0 and 1.1 RFC's if a client uses the HEAD method for the request, a response-body *must* not be returned, only the headers that would have been returned for a normal GET request for that resource. telnet myhost 8000 Trying 100.100.100.118... Connected to myhost. Escape character is '^]'. HEAD /foo HTTP/1.0 HTTP/1.1 404 /foo Content-Type: text/html Date: Tue, 27 Nov 2001 14:17:04 GMT Server: Apache Tomcat/4.0.1 (HTTP/1.1 Connector) Connection: close Apache Tomcat/4.0.1 - Error report

Apache Tomcat/4.0.1 - HTTP Status 404 - /foo

type Status report

message /foo

description The requested resource (/foo) is not available.

Connection closed by foreign host.
creator: Ryan.Lubke@Sun.COM
remm@apache.org
text:
Fixed in the CVS HEAD branch. The nightly for 11/28 will have the fix, and the 
fix will be ported to the 4.0 branch.
*** Bug 7173 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: remm@apache.org
